result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica D. Torrisi was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: DOC Balance Inquiry
Clerks note: Cash bond posted has been applied to 14CM150 & 15CM48
with elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached

Cases 14CM150, 15CM48 & 15CM186 called together at 9:26 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jessica D. Torrisi in court with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered on Ct#1-14CM150, Cts#1 & #2-15CM48 & Ct#3-15CM186; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts in each case

On Ct#1-14CM150, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence consecutive to any other sentence in being

On Count #1 -15CM48, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence consecutive to 14CM150

On Count #2 -15CM48, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 9 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence consecutive to Ct#1-15CM48

On Count #3 -15CM186, the Court sentences the Defendant to:
--serve 30 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-release privileges; to commence consecutive to Ct#2-15CM48
If revoked, the Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.

THESE SENTENCES ARE IMPOSES & STAYED AND THE COURT PLACES THE DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR 2 YEARS, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--No possession or consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs
--AODA Assessment & Follow Through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--Random drug and/or alcohol screening
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two, per Agent
--To pay statutory costs, fees and surcharges
 on each case
--To pay $200 DNA Surcharge
 each count 
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand
--To pay $25 drug testing fee (15CM186)
--No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per Agent
